text:
pro-tip: I have a shell function to get the list of products:
```bb_findall () {
    if ls lib/*.so &> /dev/null; then
        for file in lib/*.so; do
            lib=$(basename $file .so)
            var=$(echo $lib|tr - _)
            echo "    LibraryProduct(\"${lib}\", :${var}),"
	    lib=""
	    var=""
        done
    fi
    if ls bin/* &> /dev/null; then
        for file in bin/*; do
            exe=$(basename $file)
            var=$(echo $exe|tr - _)
            echo "    ExecutableProduct(\"${exe}\", :${var}),"
	    exe=""
	    var=""
        done
    fi
}```
what I do when I don't know the products is to build with
```products = Product[
]```
unpack the tarball and run the function above in the unpacked prefix

elements.text: pro-tip: I have a shell function to get the list of products:

bb_findall () {
    if ls lib/*.so &> /dev/null; then
        for file in lib/*.so; do
            lib=$(basename $file .so)
            var=$(echo $lib|tr - _)
            echo "    LibraryProduct(\"${lib}\", :${var}),"
	    lib=""
	    var=""
        done
    fi
    if ls bin/* &> /dev/null; then
        for file in bin/*; do
            exe=$(basename $file)
            var=$(echo $exe|tr - _)
            echo "    ExecutableProduct(\"${exe}\", :${var}),"
	    exe=""
	    var=""
        done
    fi
}
what I do when I don't know the products is to build with

products = Product[
]
unpack the tarball and run the function above in the unpacked prefix
